question: In which of the following immunodeficiencies, this chest X-ray finding is usually seen?
exp: Chest X-ray: pneumonia with multiple pneumatoceles, suggestive of Staphylococcal pneumonia. Recurrent abscesses and staphylococcal infection is a feature of Hyper IgE syndrome. Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome- eczema, thrombocytopenia, recurrent infections Di George syndrome- cardiac anomaly, abnormal face, thymic hypoplasia, hypocalcemia Chediak Higashi syndrome- hypopigmented hairs, recurrent infections, ataxia

question: What is the probable genetic defect in this child with recurrent infections, tetany, oral candidiasis & a hea murmur?
exp: Digeorge syndrome: Caused by 22q deletion C- Cardiac anomaly A- Abnormal facies (hypeelorism, antimongoloid slant, sho philtrum, mandibular hypoplasia. T- Thymic hypoplasia C- Cleft palate H- Hypocalcemia

question: A child with pigment dilution of skin and eyes, hemorrhagic diathesis, ceroid deposition within the reticuloendothelial system has:-
exp: Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome Oculocutaneous albinism Ceroid accumulation in lysosomes Prolonged bleeding time. Bloom syndrome : Erythema and telangiectasia on face after exposure to sunlight Immunodeficiency, GI malabsorption and hypogonadism are common. Alezzandrini syndrome: Deafness Vitiligo Poliosis Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada syndrome: Vitiligo associated with uveitis Dysacusia Meningoencephalitis

question: The commonest primary immunodeficiency is?
exp: Isolated IgA Deficiency: commonest immunodeficiency (1/600) Affected individuals have extremely low levels of both serum and secretory IgA C/F: asymptomatic, recurrent respiratory infections

question: In genetic deficiency of MPO, the increased susceptibility to infection is due to:
exp: In MPO deficiency there is decreased microbial killing because of defective MPO--H2O2 system, so there is an inability to produce hydroxyl halide radicals.
opc: Inability to produce hydroxyl halide radicals

question: 22q11 deletion leading to Di George syndrome is associated with:-
exp: DIGEORGE SYNDROME/ VELO CARDIO FACIAL SYNDROME: C- Cardiac defects A- Abnormal facies T- Thymic hypoplasia C- Cleft palate H- Hypocalcemia (d/t hypothyroidism) 22- 22q deletion

question: Both B and T cell defect is present in all EXCEPT:
exp: X-linked Agammaglobulinemia is a B cell defect

question: Chediak Higashi syndrome is characterized by the following EXCEPT:
exp: Chediak-Higashi syndrome: Neutropenia (most common) Defective degranulation Delayed microbial killing Giant granules

question: True about SCID in children is:
exp: SCID: It is due to adenosine deaminase deficiency SCID- combined antibody and cellular defect Live vaccines are contraindicated in SCID Patients with SCID have very small thymus; tonsils & adenoids are also absent or underdeveloped
opa: It is due to adenosine deaminase deficiency
opc: Child should receive double dose of all vaccines
opd: Patients with SCID have normal thymus

question: "Hereditary angioneurotic edema" is due to deficiency of:
exp: Hereditary angioneurotic edema occurs due to deficient or defective C1 inhibitor Protein S deficiency- | risk of venous thrombosis

question: Class IV lupus nephritis is:
exp: Classification of Lupus Nephritis Class I Minimal Mesangial Lupus Nephritis Class II Mesangial Proliferative Lupus Nephritis Class III Focal Proliferative Lupus Nephritis Class IV Diffuse Proliferative Lupus Nephritis Class V Membranous Lupus Nephritis Class VI Advanced Sclerotic Lupus Nephritis

question: Which of the following can be seen in SCID?
exp: SCID (Severe Combined Immunodeficiency) Combined deficiency of B & T cells seen; so autoimmune ds, granuloma formation & graft rejection are absent GVHD which is due to immune-competent cells attacking an immunosuppressed host can still be seen

question: Which of the following is not found in DiGeorge's syndrome?
exp: Disease Primary defect Secondary defect DiGeorge Syndrome (Thymic Hypoplasia) 22q11 deletion Failure of development of 3rd & 4th pharyngeal pouches T-cell defect Tetany Congenital defects of hea and great vessels Mucocutaneous candidiasis

question: Most sensitive antibody for SLE:
exp: Autoantibodies in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) Antibody Clinical Utility Antinuclear antibodies Best screening test/Most sensitive Anti-ds DNA Specific, correlate with disease activity, nephritis, vasculitis Anti-Sm Most Specific for SLE, marker for CNS lupus Anti-RNP Not specific for SLE Anti-Ro/La (SS-A) Sicca syndrome, neonatal lupus with congenital hea block Anti-histone Drug-induced lupus

question: Joint erosions are typically absent in:`
exp: Ahritis seen in SLE is Non-erosive ahritis (without deformity).

question: Tonsils are absent in:
exp: Tonsils are absent in X linked agammaglobulinemia
